1111666409828810752.text: Love this interview with Eric @EricRWeinstein by Lex @lexfridman:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wq9x2QcZN0 …

1111683607142096896.text:
To a technical and design oriented guy, this is like @Beyonce or @kanyewest giving your interview a shout out. Thanks @gvanrossum (design genius and creator of the Python programming language on which all our lives now run).

This made my damn week.https://twitter.com/gvanrossum/status/1111666409828810752 …

1111625186724462593.text: "Research is exploration in the space of ideas." Congrats to Yoshua Bengio for winning the Turing Award (the Nobel Prize of computing) with Geoffrey Hinton and Yann LeCun. It was an honor to have a conversation with him a few months back. Full video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=azOmzumh0vQ …pic.twitter.com/WqS4C8NFfj

1119968534585597952.text: It's always disappointing to me to see individuals, groups, and companies seeking to minimize short-term risk instead of maximizing long-term reward. Nobody wins when you operate from fear instead of from passion.

1113473002350497792.text: Here's my conversation with Greg Brockman @gdb, Co-Founder and CTO of @OpenAI, on the Artificial Intelligence podcast. Audio: https://lexfridman.com/greg-brockman  Video:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bIrEM2FbOLU …

1120686829987037189.text: Tesla's Autonomy Day presentation yesterday showed a lot of fascinating details about Autopilot. I'll cover key ideas in future videos. 100,000 automated lanes changes per day is just incredible. But please take my humble advice: no matter what, keep your eyes on the road.

1122128514780626945.text: Math is beautiful. Our education system does not often reveal this. It's a lost opportunity to inspire creative young minds who are captivated by the incredible mysteries of our universe.

1121422404167897089.text: Toyota revolutionized manufacturing with its "Toyota Way" principles in 2001. I love it when people operate under clear principles. My favorite from Toyota is the continuous process of improvement (kaizen) focused especially on the elimination of activities that waste time.

1114930270564753411.text: No amount of money in this world can buy my opinion. Character, integrity, hard work, and kindness is everything.

1113136748815630336.text: Our dataset of human behavior in Level 2 vehicles is growing quickly! The new addition is several thousand miles with Super Cruise enabled. 2 cameras on the driver to measure attention, cognitive load, body position, emotion, etc. Our data logger device: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HVx9bwiMWGQ …pic.twitter.com/66gzOMPpp3

1118916291857928192.text: Here's my conversation with Ian Goodfellow (@goodfellow_ian) on the Artificial Intelligence podcast. He's the author of the popular textbook on deep learning and is a leading researcher on GANs, adversarial learning, and ML security.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z6rxFNMGdn0 …

1122887014670655488.text: Here's my conversation with Oriol Vinyals (@OriolVinyalsML) on the Artificial Intelligence podcast. He and his colleagues are behind many recent breakthrough ideas in AI. At @DeepMindAI he co-lead the development of AlphaStar that beat humans in StarCraft.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kedt2or9xlo …

1116722843230834693.text: Here's my conversation with @elonmusk on the Artificial Intelligence podcast. Focus was on Tesla Autopilot & last week's release of @MIT research on functional vigilance. My hope is this catalyzes further nuanced conversation about AI & safety in driving.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dEv99vxKjVI …

1121766150357045248.text: The simple solution is often the best solution.

1113870913546670080.text: The following is our paper on driver functional vigilance during use of Tesla Autopilot driver assistance system. We analyzed 18,928 Autopilot disengagements. 3+ years of hard work with an incredible research team at MIT. Example videos out next week. https://hcai.mit.edu/human-side-of-tesla-autopilot/ …pic.twitter.com/QYJn6XCG8y

1119604196620288002.text: I got a chance to sit down for an impromptu chat with Arianna Huffington (@ariannahuff) at @MIT yesterday, talking about the meaning of life, love, mortality, and the singular obsession of brilliant minds. Video out soon.

1109862199613419521.text: If you feel the urge to post a negative comment on the internet, I suggest you also exercise regularly, go into nature, fall in love, pursue your passion, and take on difficult tasks that humble you. Perhaps then the urge for negativity will decrease & you will be happier for it.

1121094322600980480.text: Here is the introductory lecture on Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (MIT 6.S093) I taught in February. I believe that solving the human-centered challenges I outline will lead to big leaps in real-world application of AI over the next decade.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bmjamLZ3v8A …

1123254598188224512.text: An estimated 2.7 million miles are driven with Tesla Autopilot engaged every day.

1119220794171764736.text: Non-verbal communication between pedestrians and vehicles is a fascinating "dance" of human psychology. You have to use ideas from game theory, reinforcement learning, computer vision, control theory, psychology, & engineering to even begin to untangle it for autonomous vehicles.

1120329314128551936.text: Steps to being "wrong" the right way: (1) Say something you believe is true about topic X. (2) Listen, read, think, learn without ego. (3) Adjust your view on topic X. (4) Go back to step 1. Repeat daily.
